summary: This is a Palm Beach Police Department incident report continuation detailing interviews with former Epstein employees Juan and Maria Alessi on November 21, 2005, and a follow-up call with Epstein's representative, Mr. Fronstin. The Alessis describe their employment, the frequent massages at Epstein's residence involving young girls, and post-massage cleanup of sex toys. The report also notes contact from a private investigator working for attorney Roy Black.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The wealthy individual whose Palm Beach residence is the subject of a police investigation into allegations involving massages with young girls. Described as being 'very passionate about massages'.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein for 11 years. Interviewed by police with his attorney present. Described setting up massage tables, cleaning sex toys after massages, and observing that the masseuses got 'younger and younger', appearing to be 16 or 17.

persons.name: Maria Alessi
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein for 8 years (1994-2002). Interviewed by police with her attorney present. Stated she saw several young masseuses arrive at the house but did not know them personally.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.context: Attorney representing Juan and Maria Alessi during their police interview at the State Attorney's Office on November 21, 2005.

persons.name: Mr. Fronstin
persons.context: Individual who telephoned the investigating officer on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein. He relayed that Epstein would not be making a statement, that Epstein was passionate about massages, and that Epstein had donated to the Ballet of Florida for massages.

persons.name: Daliah Weiss
persons.context: Prosecutor who arranged the interview with the Alessis, requested a court reporter, and was present during the statements on November 21, 2005.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Attorney whose law office employed a private investigator who contacted Juan Alessi prior to his police interview to ascertain what he would tell police.

persons.name: Ms. Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned by Juan Alessi as Epstein's girlfriend whom he originally dealt with before dealing directly with Epstein.

persons.name: Joseph Recarey
persons.context: The investigating officer who reported the narrative, conducted the interviews, and spoke with Mr. Fronstin.

persons.name: Nickie A. Altomaro
persons.context: Person who entered the report into the system.

connections.description: Epstein employed Alessi for 11 years as a house manager, driver, and maintenance person.
Epstein employed Maria Alessi for 8 years as a house cleaner and preparer.
Married couple who both worked for Jeffrey Epstein.
Murrell represented both Juan and Maria Alessi during their police interview.
Murrell represented both Juan and Maria Alessi during their police interview.
Fronstin acted as Epstein's representative, communicating with police on his behalf and relaying his messages.
Described by Juan Alessi as Epstein's girlfriend and an initial point of contact for household matters.
Black's law office employed a private investigator who contacted witness Juan Alessi, indicating Black was likely part of Epstein's defense team.

events.title: Alessi Police Interviews
events.description: Juan and Maria Alessi, former employees of Jeffrey Epstein, are interviewed by police and ASA Daliah Weiss at the State Attorney's Office with their attorney Donnie Murrell present. A court reporter records their statements.

events.title: Private Investigator Contacts Witness
events.description: Approximately November 11, 2005, a private investigator from the Law Office of Roy Black contacts Juan Alessi. They meet at a restaurant to discuss what Alessi would tell police.

events.title: Fronstin Relays Epstein's Message
events.description: Mr. Fronstin calls the investigating officer to relay a message from Jeffrey Epstein, stating Epstein would not give a statement but is passionate about therapeutic massages and had donated to the Ballet of Florida for them.

events.title: Maria Alessi Employment Period
events.description: Maria Alessi states she worked for Jeffrey Epstein for eight years, from 1994 through 2002.

locations: State Attorney Office (location of Alessi interviews)
Boynton Beach (location of Carrabba's Restaurant where Alessi met with private investigator)
keyFacts: Juan Alessi, Epstein's former house manager, stated the masseuses visiting Epstein's home got 'younger and younger', appearing to be 'sixteen or seventeen years of age at the most'.
Juan Alessi described having to clean a 'massager/vibrator and a long rubber penis' from the sink after massages, and that the bed 'would almost always have to be made after the massage'.
A private investigator working for defense attorney Roy Black contacted witness Juan Alessi prior to his police interview to ascertain what he would tell authorities.
Epstein's representative, Mr. Fronstin, told police Epstein was 'very passionate about massages' and had allegedly donated over $100,000 to the Ballet of Florida for massages.
Maria Alessi stated that when Epstein was in residence, he did not want to encounter the Alessis, indicating a desire for privacy during his stays.
